eu_initiatives: The opportunities and challenges facing the rail sector of the UK leaving the European Union
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
goals__remit: The Railway Industry Association (RIA) is the representative body for UK-based suppliers to the UK and world-wide railways. It has some 200 companies in membership and the sector employs 240,000 people and contributes annually £11 billion Gross Value Added (GVA). It is also a growing industry with the number of rail journeys expected to double over the next 25 years and freight set to grow significantly too. RIA’s membership is active across the whole of railway supply, covering a diverse range of products and services and including both multi-national companies and SMEs (60% by number). RIA works to promote the importance of the rail system to UK plc, to help export UK expertise around the globe and to share best practice and innovation across the industry.
relevant_communication: A workshop with Euractiv and the Rail Delivery Group on 20 February to discuss rail issues.
